name: Rational, Irrational, Real, Imaginary Numbers
description: Understanding different types of numbers including rational, irrational, real, and imaginary numbers; their properties and operations.

name: Prime Numbers and Factorization
description: Exploring prime numbers, composite numbers, prime factorization, and their applications.

name: Greatest Common Divisor and Least Common Multiple
description: Calculating the greatest common divisor (GCD) and least common multiple (LCM) of integers; applications in solving problems.

name: Ratio and Proportions
description: Understanding ratios, proportions, and their applications in solving real-world problems.

name: Simple and Compound Interest
description: Calculating simple and compound interest; understanding concepts of principal, rate, and time.

name: Exponents and Powers
description: Working with exponents and powers; laws of exponents; scientific notation.

name: Expressions and Equations
description: Understanding algebraic expressions, equations, and their manipulation.

name: Linear Equations
description: Solving linear equations in one or more variables.

name: Quadratic Equations
description: Solving quadratic equations using various methods; discriminant; nature of roots.

name: Polynomials
description: Understanding polynomials; operations on polynomials; factorization.

name: Remainder and Factor Theorems
description: Applying the Remainder and Factor Theorems in polynomial division and factorization.

name: Inequalities
description: Solving and graphing linear and quadratic inequalities.

name: Lines and Angles
description: Fundamentals of lines and angles; types of angles; properties of parallel lines.

name: Triangles
description: Properties of triangles; congruence and similarity; Pythagoras theorem.

name: Quadrilaterals
description: Different types of quadrilaterals; their properties and theorems.

name: Circles
description: Properties of circles; chords, tangents, arcs, and angles.

name: Area and Volume
description: Calculating the area and volume of various geometrical shapes and solids.

name: Surface Area
description: Calculating the surface area of three-dimensional objects.

name: Heron's Formula
description: Using Heron's formula to find the area of a triangle when sides are known.

name: Trigonometric Ratios
description: Defining sine, cosine, tangent, and other trigonometric ratios; right-angled triangles.

name: Trigonometric Identities
description: Understanding and applying fundamental trigonometric identities.

name: Solving Trigonometric Equations
description: Solving equations involving trigonometric functions.

name: Applications of Trigonometry
description: Using trigonometry in real-world applications like heights and distances.

name: Straight Lines
description: Equation of straight lines; slope; intercepts; distance between points.

name: Conic Sections
description: Studying conic sections: circle, parabola, ellipse, and hyperbola.

name: Arithmetic Sequences
description: Understanding arithmetic sequences and series; finding sums.

name: Geometric Sequences
description: Understanding geometric sequences and series; finding sums.

name: Infinite Series
description: Exploring infinite series; convergence and divergence.

name: Counting Principles
description: Fundamental counting principle; permutations and combinations.

name: Binomial Theorem
description: Expanding expressions using binomial theorem; applications.

name: Matrices
description: Understanding matrices; operations; types of matrices.

name: Determinants
description: Calculating determinants; properties; applications in solving equations.

name: Vector Algebra
description: Understanding vectors; operations like addition, scalar multiplication.

name: Dot and Cross Product
description: Calculating dot product and cross product of vectors; applications.

name: Applications of Vectors
description: Using vectors in physics and geometry; applications in problems.

name: 3D Geometry
description: Understanding three-dimensional coordinate geometry; planes and lines in space.

name: Sets and Relations
description: Basics of set theory; relations and their properties.

name: Types of Functions
description: Understanding different types of functions; domain and range.

name: Function Operations
description: Operations with functions including addition, composition.

name: Inverse Functions
description: Finding inverse functions; properties and applications.

name: Limits and Continuity
description: Understanding limits and continuity of functions.

name: Derivatives
description: Differentiation techniques; derivatives of functions.

name: Continuity and Differentiability
description: Analyzing functions for continuity and differentiability.

name: Applications of Derivatives
description: Using derivatives for finding maxima and minima; rates of change.

name: Integrals
description: Introduction to integration; techniques and applications.

name: Differential Equations
description: Solving basic differential equations; initial value problems.

name: Applications of Linear Programming
description: Applying linear programming techniques to solve real-world optimization problems.

name: Probability
description: Fundamentals of probability; calculating probabilities; conditional probability.

name: Statistics
description: Descriptive statistics; measures of central tendency and dispersion; data analysis.

name: Data Interpretation
description: Interpreting data from charts, graphs, and tables; making inferences based on data.
